title: Can you guys be more serious about this channel?

replies.msg: This can be a great platform for people around the world to understand what is going one in Hong Kong. Please refrain from using meaningless Cantonese slangs that no English speaking person would understand. Show a little class.
Also, stop posting the same thing over and over again. Redundancy hugely affect readability.
Already showing the best we got, this way sir
U england so bad
Push, Its not used for having fun in this moment
Agree. If any foreigners have question to ask, please feel free to do so
We need translate our slangs for foreigners ah
Agger
Agreed. Applause to Lin jai

quote.msg: This can be a great platform for people around the world to understand what is going one in Hong Kong. Please refrain from using meaningless Cantonese slangs that no English speaking person would understand. Show a little class.

replies.msg: I think lin jai should also set a column for heated discussion just like what we have in the Cantonese interface? So that the posts with genuine discussions can be differentiated from the on9 posts (sorry for the slang but I assume u can understand Canto)

quote.msg: We need translate our slangs for foreigners ah

replies.msg: Is it really important to translate slangs? Don’t we have better things to do like explaining police brutality?
bro, show ur lihkg culture and share the info to the WORLD!
Exactly. It would be pointless to get our messages across by employing Cantonese slang or even internet jargons, but only manifest our naiveness and imaturity based on the way we talk.
agree!! and please dont use chinglish

Push

This new channel should have more important information instead of repeated nonsense. We also need to translate some news.
yes, over

quote.msg: Agree. If any foreigners have question to ask, please feel free to do so

replies.msg:
Even if they can’t, it would be a good platform for them to contact the local and get the firsthand news from us.

Thanks Lin Jai for building this page. Bro and Sis, it’s our turn now. Let’s let the world hear us.
